content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES

#### Iron Ore Mine at position (16.0, 71.0)
Consists of 
- Burner Mining Drill (position x=16.0, y=71.0)
- Chest (position x=15.5, y=69.5) to collect iron ore
- Burner Inserter (position x=14.5, y=69.5) to output iron ore from chest (currently facing down, pickup position x=14.5 y=68.5, drop position x=14.5 y=70.5)
- Burner Inserter (position x=16.5, y=69.5) to input iron ore into furnace (currently facing right, pickup position x=15.5 y=69.5, drop position x=17.5 y=69.5)
- BeltGroup (positions x=14.5 y=70.5, x=17.5 y=69.5) that connects the output inserter to the input inserter (inventory has 17 iron ore)
- Furnace (position x=19.0, y=71.0) to smelt iron ore into iron plates
- Chest (position x=21.5, y=71.5) to collect iron plates
- Burner Inserter (position x=20.5, y=71.5) to output iron plates into chest (currently facing left, pickup position x=21.5 y=71.5, drop position x=19.5 y=71.5)
- Burner Inserter (position x=19.5, y=68.5) to output iron plates from furnace (currently facing down, pickup position x=19.5 y=67.5, drop position x=19.5 y=69.5)
- Burner Inserter (position x=20.5, y=68.5) to transfer iron plates to output chest (currently facing left, pickup position x=21.5 y=68.5, drop position x=19.5 y=68.5)
- BeltGroup (positions x=19.5 y=69.5, x=21.5 y=68.5) that connects the furnace output inserter to the output chest

### ERROR TIPS

* Errors when placing entities too close to other entities
  - Ensure sufficient spacing between entities to avoid collisions
  - Consider increasing the spacing or changing the direction when placing entities next to each other
* Errors when connecting entities directly
  - Use inserters to take items from source entities (e.g., chests, furnaces) before connecting to other entities
* Errors when attempting to place entities at occupied positions
  - Check if a position is occupied before attempting to place an entity
* Errors when connecting transport belts to entities that are not compatible
  - Ensure that transport belts are connected to compatible entities (e.g., inserters, other transport belts)
  - Avoid connecting transport belts directly to chests or other entities that do not support direct belt connections
* Syntax errors
  - Ensure that 'return' statements are used within functions
* Errors when inserters are not correctly oriented
  - Check the direction of inserters to ensure they are correctly picking up and dropping off items
* Errors when transport belts are blocked
  - Clear the belt at the blocked position to continue mining or processing
  - As seen in step 50, 56, and 66, clearing the belt at x=17.5 y=69.5 resolved the blockage
* Errors when attempting to retrieve entities at non-existent positions
  - Verify that the position of the entity exists before attempting to retrieve it
* Errors when attempting to insert items into furnaces without sufficient ingredients
  - Check if the furnace has sufficient ingredients before attempting to insert more items
  - As seen in step 52, 58, and 71, the furnace was waiting for ingredients
* Errors when connecting transport belts with invalid paths
  - Ensure that transport belts are connected in a valid path to avoid normalisation failures
* Errors when normalising belt connections
  - Check that the belt connection path is valid and can be normalised
* Errors when entities are running out of fuel
  - Refuel entities (e.g., burner mining drills, furnaces) before they run out of fuel
  - As seen in step 55, the drill needed refueling
* Errors when attempting to extract items from empty belts
  - Check if the belt has items before attempting to extract
  - As seen in step 57, 62, and 66, attempting to extract iron-ore from an empty belt resulted in an error
* Errors when attempting to insert items into furnaces with incompatible ingredients
  - Check if the furnace already contains a product before attempting to insert ingredients
  - As seen in step 58, the furnace already contained iron
